update.description:
Final PR in this series of performance improvements. This requires: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/143.

The main changes:

1. A `msgs::SerializedStateMap` message is used to help keep track of entities and components in a message so that we don't have to keep creating new messages.

2. A component knows when it has changed. Only changed components are serialized in the `msgs::SerializedStateMap`. This prevents static models from being serialized every iteration.

The major drawback to this PR is that log files generated by a previous version are not compatible with this change because the of the msgs change.

You should be able to run the example tunnel world faster than realtime. I saw between 110 and 120%.

```
ign gazebo -v 4 tunnel.sdf -z 100000 -r
```
update.title: Nate testing scenebroad improvements

content.raw: Recording and playback of log files seems to work.
content.html: Recording and playback of log files seems to work.

content.raw: This is ready. The crash I reported in yesterday's meeting was due to my system setup. I had to update ign-launch.
content.html: This is ready. The crash I reported in yesterday's meeting was due to my system setup. I had to update ign-launch.

update.description:
Final PR in this series of performance improvements. This requires: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/143.

The main changes:

1. A `msgs::SerializedState2` message is used to help keep track of entities and components in a message so that we don't have to keep creating new messages.

2. A component knows when it has changed. Only changed components are serialized in the `msgs::SerializedState`. This prevents static models from being serialized every iteration.

The major drawback to this PR is that log files generated by a previous version are not compatible with this change. I'm okay with this.

You should be able to run the example tunnel world faster than realtime. I saw between 110 and 120%.

```
ign gazebo -v 4 tunnel.sdf -z 100000 -r
```
update.title: Nate testing scenebroad improvements

content.raw: Probably not in the scope of this PR, but a potential enhancement here is have a keyframe mechanism to store complete state periodically, and then store incremental from that.  It would reduce some of the compute on replaying \(especially in tools like plotting or seeking through logs\).
content.html: Probably not in the scope of this PR, but a potential enhancement here is have a keyframe mechanism to store complete state periodically, and then store incremental from that. It would reduce some of the compute on replaying (especially in tools like plotting or seeking through logs).

update.description:
Final PR in this series of performance improvements. This requires: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/143.

The main changes:

1. A `msgs::SerializedState2` message is used to help keep track of entities and components in a message so that we don't have to keep creating new messages.

2. A component knows when it has changed. Only changed components are serialized in the `msgs::SerializedState`. This prevents static models from being serialized every iteration.

The major drawback to this PR is that log files generated by a previous version are not compatible with this change. I'm okay with this.

You should be able to run the example tunnel world faster than realtime. I saw between 110 and 120%.

```
ign gazebo -v 4 tunnel.sdf -z 100000 -r
```
